section.name: What is Schema2XMI?
section.p:
Schema2XMI is a generator that will read a database schema and write your schema's into an XMI model. This is useful for a couple of reasons:
Your company wants your DBA(s) to design your schema.
Your application already has an existing schema.
You want to move an legacy application to AndroMDA.

subsection.name: How do I use Schema2XMI?
subsection.p: Schema2XMI is a command line utility that you'll pass arguments to and then execute the main Schema2XMI class. The usage is defined below:
subsection.source:
usage: org.andromda.schema2xmi.Schema2XMI [options] ...]]
Options: -P,--package The package to output classifiers -T,--typeMappings <arg> The type mappings URI (i.e. file:${basedir}/DataypeMappings.xml) -c,--connectionUrl <arg> JDBC connection URL -d,--driver <arg> JDBC driver class -h,--help Display help information -i,--input Input model file (to which model elements will be added) -o,--output <arg> Set output name to which the result of the transformation will be written -p,--password <arg> Schema user password -t,--tableNamePattern The table name pattern of tables to process (regular expression) -u,--user <arg> Schema user name -v,--taggedValues Whether or not to include persistence tagged values, default is true
